info.li: Material from 5 dy old Arabidopsis thaliana T87 suspension cells of the Columbia-0 ecotype was analyzed.
Cells were grown in the Gamborg B5 medium with 3% sucrose and 0.5 μm NAA in a growth chamber under 16/8 light/dark conditions at 120 rpm and 20 degrees Celcius.
Cells were treated with 50 μm ABA, 5 mM DMTU and 0.5% ethanol as the control for 20 hours.
Measurements were taken in triplicates - the average of which is shown.
RNA was isolated and hybridized to the ATH1 GeneChip. The data were normalized by GCOS normalization, TGT 100.
Results from Bohmer and Schroeder (2001), The Plant Journal. DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-313X.2001.04579.x.
